column25: Listen without judging, Help with daily tasks, Promote medical care, Support healthy habits, Research and learn about the subject, Lately on social networks this wave of machismo has spread that says that women have an "expiration date", when it is known that men's sperm at a certain age is no longer viable for a healthy product. Comments like that take away from the woman as an individual and human. Menopause should not be seen as something "negative", aging fully is essential, and giving women a dignified menopause where they are not made to feel bad for losing their reproductive capacity or advancing in age is extremely important, since the value of a woman is not reduced to being a mother or being young. Due to this shame, many women also neglect their physical health, and it is essential that they also attend medical check-ups. Unfortunately, doctors are also somewhat biased and outdated on the subject.
